page.title: 18WILDLIFE IN INVERUGIE
page.content: Although few people realise it, wildlife abounds in the Inverugie area. In the river itself, besides salmon and trout, there are eels, lampreys and even freshwater mussels: pearl fishers used to be common on the Ugie. The wide variety of birds includes game-birds such as pheasants and partridges and birds of prey such as kestrels, sparrowhawks and owls. The magpie population has increased over the years. Varieties of ducks vary with the season- mallards, golden-eyed ducks and sometimes visiting merganzers. An off-course flamingo was even seen in the area! River-side mammals include otters, mink, stoats, moles, bats, rabbits, hedgehogs and several varieties of rodents. Further afield there are roe deer, foxes and badgers.
